Register Now        Request Information        Events                                                                  Whether your goal is to move ahead in your career, change your professional direction, or deepen your appreciation of the humanities, arts, and writing, you’ll find a rich array of noncredit courses and certificates from which to choose. Explore subjects that stir your imagination with faculty members who are eager to share their expertise and their passion. Enjoy the intellectual stimulation of a vibrant learning community.           Ready to Proceed?        Register for Courses Now                 Noncredit Courses        Whether analyzing an artistic masterpiece, taking in a theatrical performance, or immersing yourself in a creative writing project, studying the world's greatest forms of human expression provides an ideal way to broaden your horizons. Through thought-provoking discussion and intellectual exploration, the NYU School of Professional Studies continuing education courses in the humanities and the performing arts help you to sharpen your critical thinking skills, engage in cultural discovery, and communicate with diverse audiences.   Our courses in literature, film, theater, performing arts, history, archaeology, philosophy, and religion can spark your curiosity and challenge you to view the world from a fresh perspective. Read and discuss great books. Discover the masters of American cinema or become engrossed in the work of modern European philosophers. Explore New York City's theater scene as an audience member or take to the stage in one of our many acting and performance courses.            A Selection of Courses From This Department                                              Appraisal of Historical Textiles and Clothing                                                            Great Choral Compositions in Classical Music                                                            Independent Study in Photography                                                            Literature and Film Go Back to High School                                                            Manhattan's Residential Secrets                                                            Writing Film Dialogue                                                                               View all Humanities, Arts, and Writing Noncredit Courses           Certificates        If you’re seeking an effective way to move your career forward, earning a noncredit certificate through the NYU School of Professional Studies allows you to acquire proficiency in a specific professional arena. Designed to accommodate the schedules of busy professionals, certificate programs offer in-depth knowledge and unique insights into subject matter, allowing you to gain significant expertise and industry-specific skills. This powerful credential can help you to achieve your career goals and greatly enhance your résumé. Summer 2015 On-Campus Writing Workshops , CWP | NYU                         NEW YORK UNIVERSITY       ARTS AND SCIENCE       COLLEGE OF ARTS AND SCIENCE       GRADUATE SCHOOL OF ARTS AND SCIENCE                           Creative Writing Program                                                                                                Back to  previous page                Printer Friendly       Summer 2015 On-Campus Writing Workshops The Creative Writing Program offers introductory and intermediate writing workshops throughout the summer.  Our summer writing workshops are open to NYU and visiting students. NYU students may register for the summer term via Albert starting February 17, 2015. Visiting students should refer to the Summer in NYC website for registration information and instructions. High school students should consult the NYU Precollege website to learn more about our precollege offerings.     SUMMER 2015 WORKSHOP SCHEDULE Summer Session I: May 26 - July 2, 2015 Summer Session II: July 6 - August 15, 2015 *Interested in taking a creative writing workshop in summer 2015? Fill out this form for news and updates. And follow the NYU Creative Writing Program on Facebook  and  Twitter !*      COURSE OFFERINGS    CRWRI-UA 815 Creative Writing: Introduction to Fiction and Poetry (Multiple Sections) No prerequisite. 4 points. The popular introductory workshop offers an exciting introduction to the basic elements of poetry and fiction—with in-class writing, take-home reading and writing assignments, and substantive discussions of craft. The course is structured as a workshop, which means that students will receive feedback from their instructor and their fellow writers in a roundtable setting, and should be prepared to offer their classmates responses to their work.                     Summer Session I  Section 2 TR 1:30pm-4:40pm Matthew Lansburgh Provisional Syllabus Section 6 MW 1:30pm-4:40pm Gail Carson Levine Provisional Syllabus    Summer Session II Section 1 MW 1:30pm-4:40pm Toby Lloyd Section 3 TR 1:30pm-4:40pm Stephanie Arditte    Precollege Sections (For High School Students) We offer two precollege sections of CRWRI-UA 815 Creative Writing: Introduction to Fiction & Poetry ( Section 60  and  Section 61 ). Both sections meet TR 1:30-4:40 during Summer Session II.  Please visit the NYU Precollege  website  for more information and application instructions.   CWRI-UA 816 001 Intermediate Fiction Workshop ( Summer Session II ) MW 4:00-7:10 Provisional Syllabus Sharon Mesmer    CRWRI-UA 817 001 Intermediate Poetry Workshop ( Summer Session II ) Provisional Syllabus TR 4:00-7:10 Geoffrey Nutter                 Back to Top                                         Contact Us | © New York University , Arts and Science

Creative Writing Program | New York University                      NEW YORK UNIVERSITY       ARTS AND SCIENCE       COLLEGE OF ARTS AND SCIENCE       GRADUATE SCHOOL OF ARTS AND SCIENCE                                                                                            Home       Faculty       Undergraduate Program       Graduate Program       Low-Residency MFA Writers Workshop in Paris       Summer Programs & Courses       Reading Series       Literary Journals       History of the Lillian Vernon Creative Writers House       Donate to the Creative Writing Program       Alumni News & Publications         “Great books are books that have two authors, the reader and the writer.”   Jonathan Safran Foer           The NYU Creative Writing Program, among the most distinguished programs in the country, is a leading national center for the study of writing and literature. The undergraduate and graduate programs provide students with an opportunity to develop their craft while working closely with some of the finest poets and novelists writing today. The Creative Writing Program now occupies a lovely townhouse on West 10th Street in the same Greenwich Village neighborhood where so many writers have lived and worked. The Lillian Vernon Creative Writers House allows writers--established and emerging--to share their work in an inspiring setting. We invite you to join a supportive and serious community of writers engaged in an exceptional program of study.
